p: The prevalence of Dengue specific antibodies (IgM and IgG) was 69.23% and of this 66.15% (172 subjects) were positives for Dengue IgG antibodies. Among the Dengue IgG positives, 66.28% in females and 33.72% in males. There was no statistical difference between Dengue IgG prevalence and gender (p = 0.427) (Table 2). Patients within the age group 21–30 years were observed to have the highest Dengue IgG prevalence of 65.84% (54/82). There was significant association between Dengue IgG seropositivity and age groups (p = 0.01). Serum from subjects within the age group of 5–14 years were not found to be positive for Dengue IgG antibodies.
